Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant was denied procedural fairness by not being granted an oral hearing
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, s. 113(b)
Evidence_Assessment: Officer questioned applicant's credibility due to insufficient evidence
Decision_Outcome: Application for judicial review allowed; decision set aside
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to establish risk and credibility
Credibility_Factor: Central to the decision; officer disbelieved applicant's story
Legal_Rule: Oral hearing required if credibility is central and could lead to negative outcome
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness (implied by judicial review context)
Procedural_Issue: Denial of oral hearing despite credibility concerns
Grounds_for_Claim: Procedural unfairness in refusal of oral hearing
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Error found in denying oral hearing
Key_Evidence_Considered: FARC's violent acts, lack of state protection, applicant's narrative
Legal_Framework: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and associated Regulations
Applicant_Challenge: Lack of oral hearing affecting fairness
Court_Result: Decision set aside, matter referred to new officer
Outcome: Remanded for redetermination with new officer
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Insufficient evidence to support claimed risk
Outcome_of_Review: In favor of applicant on procedural grounds
